cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north, then turning northwest toward the South Carolina coast; expected to move inland across SC Sunday and then accelerate northeast along the U.S. East Coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina coast between Charleston and Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Georgia through North Carolina coasts, especially South Carolina shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Up to 45 mph sustained winds possible with gusts higher; 48% chance of 34-kt (gale) winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated surf and dangerous rip currents; minor coastal inundation possible but surge heights not expected to exceed 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain totaling 2â€’4 inches through the weekend.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous marine conditions for vessel operations and pilot transfers.
